description: 3D Slime is a fast game that mixes the munching from Pac-Man with the isometric perspective from the contemporary Gyroscope. Players control Green Slime, a green piece of slime from Vega 3 that has been captured by a certain Rodrick. He forces Green Slime into Robocity to steal purple pyramids for him. Green Slime needs to collect these while avoiding black bowling balls by hopping from one tile to another. For each collected pyramid points are scored and all of them need to be gathered to move on to a new environment. The pseudo 3D levels are often built in irregular patterns with inaccessible black spaces and separate areas that are reached through a single path and with a different elevation. To get there the bowling balls need to be lured away to clear the path. High scores are stored directly on the cartridge and it includes a boss key that immediately draws a fake spreadsheet called MEGACALC IV.
title: 3D Slime

description: Wroom! is a Formula 1 racing game, viewed from the cockpit of the car, with a map of the track displayed above. The player competes against 10 opponents and must arrive first in order to progress. There are 5 Grand Prix circuits with real world tracks, such as Zeltweg and Austria.
title: Wroom!

description:
Long time ago, the dwarven kingdom was attacked by the men of Caras who came from the south. The dwarves, nearly defeated, had retreated to their last refuge, the Domed City in the Forsaken Mountains, to mount their last defense. With the help of the great wizard Taradon they've managed to repel the enemy, but it was a Pyrrhic victory: most of them fell in the battle.

You were brought by Eldomir to a place where the entrance to the ancient cave should be found. Tales about adventurers who didn't return did not discourage you, as you were drawn by the legend of great treasures said to be hidden in the dwarves' mountain dwelling.

The Lost Kingdom of Zkul is a text adventure set in a fantasy world. What makes it different, is that events occur in real-time (what makes traps even more dangerous) and that the labyrinth changes each time you start a new adventure. Apart from the helpful save function, the player has 3 lives - all collected items, however, remain on the deceased body.
title: The Lost Kingdom of Zkul

description: Spook is a Pac-Man variant that stays close to the concept of the original game. The player controls a muncher that needs to eat all dots inside a maze to move on to the next one. Meanwhile he is chased by ghosts. Power pills turn the tables and allow the character to chase and eat the ghosts, causing them to respawn in the middle of the screen. Fruit can be eaten for extra points. This game introduces red doors that slide and swing as an additional hazard.
title: Spook

description: BJ the Return: QL Caverns 2 is the sequel to QL Cavern. It is an arcade game that picks up the story after the previous one. After BJ's friend Drunx was defeated/killed in the first game, the protagonist BJ is left helpless in the caverns. The only way for him to escape is to collect all the magic items, called 'miracles', in the cave for the good fairy Matilda to be able to help him out. The character needs to navigate different rooms that are connected horizontally and vertically. BJ needs to avoid monsters and obstacles. Items in the environment that can be used include trampolines.

sample_screenshots.caption: Demo screen 25 - Imps guarding oven fires
Demo screen 41 - A suspicious layout in the center of the star.
Demo screen 16 - Some floppies and a laser

title: BJ the Return: QL Caverns 2

description:
Zapper with Eagle contains two arcade games in a single package not available separately:

  • Zapper is a Space Invaders clone. A ship at the bottom of the screen can be moved horizontally and it needs to shoot waves of alien ships approaching from above. There are multiple lives and eight levels. Only one missile can be fired at a time, so you have to wait until it hits or leaves the screen before firing the next one.

  • Eagle is a Defender clone. The player controls a ship through an area that can be traveled through horizontally, defeating all aliens ships that are encountered.
title: Zapper with Eagle

description: Strip Poker is an electronic conversion of the strip poker card game. Played from the first-person perspective, the game of draw poker is played against the female character Denise starting with £200 stake money. The standard bet is £10 and upping the ante is done with £5. Actions while playing are raise, hold or wait. Whenever Denise loses a round, she removes a piece of clothing.
title: Strip Poker

description: Baron Rouge is a French 2D shooter where the player takes the role of the German fighter pilot Red Baron in a monoplane during World War I when he is on his way home. The player controls a plane on the far right side of the screen facing left. Movement is limited to up and down, so it is not possible to move horizontally. The Red Baron needs to defeat different waves of enemies appearing from the left by shooting them out of the air. Opponents include fighter planes, hang-gliders, airships, kamikaze planes ... with about 20 enemy types in total. The bottom part of the screen, about a third of the image, is taken up by cockpit controls. They cannot be operated, but show the score and remaining lives.
title: Baron Rouge

description: Gwendoline is a French 2D platformer about a knight who needs to rescue his fiancée Gwendoline who has been kidnapped and locked up in castle. The knight can move around, jump, use ladders (only to go up, but not descend) and attack with a sword. There are 38 screens in total to explore. Opponents are mainly knights, but there are also stones that fall down and other dangers, including a time limit that subtracts from the initial six lives with every second ticking away. Health can be restored by eating food such as apples or roaster. There is also ale that can be drunk, but to emulate intoxication movement then becomes more difficult: it reverses left and right while walking, but not while jumping.
title: Gwendoline

description: Alien Hijack is an isometric action-adventure game set in 2003 aboard the ship S P C Forward where the protagonist is an engineer. When the ship enters the Bermuda Triangle it is taken over by aliens and the crew vanishes. The game consists of 192 screens and to win three codes have to be collected to form an anchor and regain control of the ship. The rooms are filled with objects and moving obstacles that have to be navigated around. The character can also jump and fire at aliens to kill them. Other control options are running, picking up an object and dropping it. The latter two are used to solve small environment based puzzles. There are three lives and two meters at the bottom of the screen. One shows health (energy) and the other shows the status of the Powerpac. Health can be restored by eating food. It is one of the few QL games to support the QTalk speech synthesizer.
title: Alien Hijack

description: Knight Flight is a game similar to Joust where the players joust like medieval knights against each other, or the computer, while riding on large birdlike creatures. The game display is divided in horizontal lanes, and computer controlled birds with riders trying to unseat the player, just as the player tries to do the same to them. If a knight is unseated, the flying bird lays an egg, which soon hatches into another knight, if not collected by the player. This knight will soon be picked up by a free bird, and come to joust with the player again. There are also flying dragons to slay.
title: Knight Flight

description: Dreamlands is a text adventure game about escapism in a fantasy world. The game's protagonist leads a boring and tedious life, but one night has a very vivid dream that takes place in a strange environment. Soon a note written by the Forest Queen is found and she provides a quest. The game uses classic commands actions and movement in the text parser. Various characters are met along the way, such as the queen, a dragon and a witch. A total of 330 points can be earned.
title: Dreamlands

description:
Droidzone is an arcade space shooter played on a single screen. The game consists of several zones where the ship needs to shoot down waves of aliens to score points. The ship can move in two directions, left and right, but is tied to a hexagonal figure that always makes it move close to any border of the area with a fixed trajectory. The ship always faces inwards and needs to shoot while quickly dodging the incoming waves that use different formations. If enemies are not destroyed fast enough, the ship is quickly overwhelmed. Alien ships are not tied to the hexagonal figure and can move anywhere on the screen.

The game supports multiple players, taking turns. It is possible to alter the game speed based on three levels and there is a high score table. There are fives lives in total and every hit is fatal, but the ship always starts with a shield that makes it invincible for a few seconds.
title: Droidzone

description:
Jungle Eddi is a platform game inspired by Underwurlde and set in a jungle environment. The game consists of five levels with twenty screens each. The goal of the game is to find a door to exit, but each of the twenty screens contains two doors. In most screens entering one door makes the character appear at the other one, until the real exit is found. The screens are connected by passing the screen border in any of four directions where possible and the exit door is randomized for each session.

The character is able to perform a high jump, diagonally left or right. This is used to climb trees, reach ladders and avoid enemies. The character also needs to avoid falling down gaps at the bottom. The trees often have multiple branches that can be used to move around. Enemies can be defeated by jumping on top of them, but that is not easy to time. If the character collides with an object or a branch while jumping, he bounces back. Killing enemies is rewarded with points and additional points floating around the environment can be picked up. There are five lives at the start and every hit is fatal.
title: Jungle Eddi

description:
The Lost Pharaoh is a maze exploration game inspired by Sabre Wulf. The player controls an explorer in the tomb of a pharaoh. The goal of the game is to navigate the maze to reach the sealed burial chamber with treasure. The character can be moved in any direction as long there is a passage. The level is built up out of single screens that can be exited in any of the four directions as long as there is a way out. Green doors are used to move to another part of the screen and blue doors spawn enemies. These can be taken out by shooting a projectile and there is an unlimited amount of ammo. Enemies respawn when a section is revisited.

Certain parts are locked off and require a key, stored in stones with question marks. There are multiple gates and only the correct key will open it, not just any. At the start of the game five lives are provided and any collision with an enemy is immediately fatal. The character then respawns at the same location. The game keeps tracks of the score and also shows the amount of rooms and keys that have been found when the game is over.
title: The Lost Pharaoh

description: E.V.A. is a game with similarities to Jetpac. The player controls an astronaut in several single screen levels with some platforms. The astronaut can freely move around the screen, hovering using a jet pack, and can shoot left or right to defeat aliens that appear from the sides of the screen. The goal is to repair elements of a space station. Every now and then a piece appears. It can be picked up by the astronaut and needs to be dragged to an area marked in red to start the assembly. Once all pieces have been found a switch can be activated to move on to the next level. The game keeps track of the score and five lives are provided at the start. When dead, the astronaut immediately respawns and no progress is lost. A later, updated version of the game introduces a screen where the starting level can be selected. The game supports two players taking turns.
title: E.V.A.

description: Voyage of the Beano is a humorous and illustrated game of interactive fiction set during the colonization of the Americas. The game starts in the fishing village of Cockadoodle Bay, near London, England. The protagonist is J D Hogwash, a lowly captain. After stealing a piece of smugglers' treasure with Barnacle Bill, he is captured by a Spanish galleon by accident and eventually sent to the New World by Queen Bess to fight the Spaniards and bring back gold. Along the way there are pirates that will attempt to get to the treasure first.
title: Voyage of the Beano

description:
Stone Raider is a game inspired by Boulder Dash. The player controls a character through different single screen environments linked together. The character can dig into any direction to collect hexogems, but needs to avoid the boulders that can crush him. The game has a time limit and a certain number of hexogems needs to be found in order to complete the level. Two lives are provided at the start and the game keeps track of the score. Unlike the original Boulder Dash there are no enemies to avoid and crush.

Initially released as Stone Raider by MicroDeal, the rights were bought up by Talent Computer Systems and later RWAP Software. It was re-released as Stone Raider II. It is not identical to the 1986 Dragon 32/64 / TRS-80 CoCo game of the same name.
title: Stone Raider

description: Hoverzone is a Defender clone. The player controls a space ship that can be moved left or right in a side-scrolling environment to defeat waves of alien forces that attempt to abduct and kill a number of humans located stationary on the ground. The goal is to survive as long as possible with humans remaining. Aliens appear from both sides and the position of the aliens, the humans and the ship's position can be tracked on a large horizontal map near the top of the screen. The ship has an unlimited amount of ammo and shoots with a ray that travels instantly across the entire screen. At the start five lives are provided and collisions with aliens or the terrain below leads to instant death. The game contains five types of enemies called Grabber, Mutie, Podule, Psychocube and Zipper, and keeps track of the score.
title: Hoverzone

description: Pengi is a clone of Pengo. It is a single-screen game where Pengi, the penguin, is trapped in a maze of ice blocks and surrounded by an electric fence. There are also enemies, called Snobees, that spawn regularly. Ice blocks can be pushed by moving into them, which causes them to travel across the screen until they reach an obstacle. Points are scored by connecting diamonds in the maze and by pushing blocks into the Snobees to freeze them, after which they can be collected. Snobees are able to destroy blocks in their way. The environment is randomized for each session, there are three lives at the start and the game keeps track of the score.
title: Pengi

description: The King is based on the 1981 arcade game Donkey Kong. Just like in the original game, a man needs to reach the top of a tower by climbing ladders to rescue a girl, while a large monkey throws barrels. There are broken ladders that cannot be used to climb, but the barrels can use them to descend instead of just rolling down.It is possible to pick up a mallet to smash the barrels instead of jumping over them. There is no timer, but fast completions are rewarded with bonus points. If any of the barrels reach an oil barrel in the bottom left corner of the screen, a flame spawns that chases the character. There are a limited number of lives and several levels. The game can be played by two players, taking turns. Optionally a practice game can be played.
title: The King

description:
TRON: Light Cycles is an updated release of the 1986 QL game Light Cycle. Originally a type-in game only published in the December 1986 issue of the German magazine 68000er Sonderheft and also released in the public domain afterwards, it was updated inspired by the release of the 2010 movie Tron: Legacy. The author received permission from Walt Disney to release the game with TRON in the title.

The game is played in a single screen arena where two players, or a player against the computer, each steer a light cycle, represented by a white line. The light cycles can be moved in four directions. They leave behind a permanent trail, slowly filling up the arena. To score you need to force the other rider to ride into your line or get him stuck crashing into his own line or the arena border. The game can be played locally with two players or using the QL Network. It is possible to change the speed, the difficulty of the AI and the general difficulty of the game. The latter introduces mines in the arena from the start and these need to be avoided. The game also contains a new splash screen to reference Tron.
title: Tron: Light Cycles

description: Fight in the Dark is an arcade shooter set in space. The game consists of two phases. In the first phase alien activity needs to be picked up using a radar on a small shuttle. The shuttle then needs to dock with the main part of the ship to use the maximum amount of firepower. The second phase is the actual shooting phase. In a single-screen environment the player controls a space ship near the bottom of the screen, attacking ships that appear near the top. The waves need to be destroyed before they take out both the shuttle and the main ship. The game keeps track of the score.
title: Fight in the Dark

description:
Nebula II is a French space exploration and trading game. The player controls the space ship QLara, part of the LGM, a merchant's league. Starting with a storage facility on the home planet Terra the ship needs to travel to different planets and use the different economies to buy and sell ore and products. Each solar system has each own resources and economy and it is up to the player to analyse these price variations to take advantage of them.

While travelling there are many factors to take into account such as the cost of fuel and the risk of losing cargo when attacked by space pirates, but taking risks also leads to the highest profits and options to bargain when selling and buying. The gameplay consists of several single screen with separate parts for a camera view of the environment with icons, a data screen and a communication window with text. A sequence is also shown when travelling between planets. Fights with space pirates are displayed using a top-down view. Once on a planet more options become available with a garage for ship maintenance and a market hall to buy and sell resources all using a text based interface.
title: Nebula II

description: Othello is a conversion of the classic board game for the Sinclair QL. The game uses the classic rules for its turn-based gameplay with nine game modes. A bird's eye view of the board is available with a 3D presentation. There is an in-game help function, screen options and the ability to access a printer.
title: Othello

description: Puzzle Mania is a 2D platform game where the player's character needs to retrieve the lost loot of Lawless Lenny. At the start of the game a puzzle picture is shown with room for eight missing pieces. To win the game the eight pieces need to be collected and brought back to the starting location. The player's character needs to navigate several single-screen rooms linked together, with platform elements. The locations contain flying objects that need to be avoided as they hurt the character and remove some energy. Some rooms have batteries used to restore energy, but picking them up when it is not necessary can lead to an overcharge. Optionally the QTalk module can be used for speech.
title: Puzzle Mania

description: Flightdeck is a flight simulation where the player can fly a twin engined passenger jet using a first-person view. The environment consists of various airports and 200 landmarks as navigation beacons with 25 UK airports included. Players can freely edit the environment. From the cockpit a variety of instruments is available to control the place, including a VHF omni-directional range and distance equipment, automatic direction finding and an instrument landing system to provide aid. The environment is shown using a shaded 3D view.
title: Flightdeck

description:
The Lonely Joker is a collection of six variants of the Patience/Solitaire card game. The included variants are:* Cascade

  • Crapaud
  • Echelon
  • Four in Hand
  • Napoleon
  • Spine

All actions are controlled with a pointer, so the mouse can be used. There in an option to turn over the pack either by a single card or in sets of three.
title: The Lonely Joker

description: Black Knight is a chess game where movement is controlled through a pointer. The game follows the original rules and shows the gameplay on a top-down 2D view of the board. All the moves in a game are listed in a separate part of the screen. There is a large variety of options including the ability the change the opponent's difficulty level, demo games, determining the player's colour of the pieces and the starting position, a two-player game with hot-seat multiplayer, saving and loading games, volume control and several setup options.
title: Black Knight

description: Blast Buggy is an arcade game similar to Moon Patrol. The player controls a character driving a buggy on the surface of an alien planet. The goals is to reach the base while jumping over craters using jets to avoid crashing and shooting the aliens that prevent the buggy from reaching its destination using twin guns. The game keeps track of the score.
title: Blast Buggy

description: Night Nurse is an arcade game in which you control the night nurse Gray during her rounds at the St Spooks hospital. The goal of the game is to locate the Golden Prescription by moving through several single-screen rooms linked together using the flip-screen mechanic. Various objects need to be collected along the way, stored in an inventory. Rooms contain hazards such as randy doctors, Paranoid Pete and the forensic flu bug. Time plays a role through a meter shown near the bottom of the screen and the nurse has a stamina meter that can run out and takes some time to recharge.
title: Night Nurse

description: Double Block is a clone of the falling block puzzle game Tetris. In the standard mode the available blocks, gameplay and field are completely identical to the original title. The player stacks the falling blocks to create lines that are then cleared. The game gradually speeds up. There is a two-player mode as well as a different, more difficult mode where blocks have a different shape. The game screen shows how many blocks of a certain type have appeared, the score, the number of lines cleared, the high score of that day and the current gameplay speed.
title: Double Block

description:
The Open Golf is a golf simulation with a selection of 50 eighteen hole courses. The screen is divided into different parts. On the left side occupying about 70% of the screen there is a large bird's-eye view of the course showing the tee, hole and environment. The right side shows a 3D view of the golfer from behind. In a middle window the player determines the direction using the cursor keys, curve (slice or hook) and strength of the shot, and the type of club (e.g. driver, sandwedge, wedge, woods iron ...). Other information displayed includes the current hole number, the remaining distance, the par, maximum range for the chosen club, amount of wind, wind direction and current position of the ball. Each course has its own high score table that can be loaded before starting the game. Messages praising or mocking the player are shown in a window in the bottom right corner.

On the map a red cross highlights the ball's position. The player can press a key to enable a ruler to assess the best type of club and shot strength. The terrain includes hazards such as rough grass, bunkers, streams, lakes and trees. There are no opponents.
title: The Open Golf

description: Assault & Battery is a top-down vertically scrolling shooter. The player controls an aircraft attacking an enemy base, destroying jets and tanks along the way by shooting them. The levels have many turrets that turn to target the aircraft and these need to be avoided. By destroying certain enemy objects additional firepower and fuel is earned to continue playing. There is a small number of lives and the game keeps track of the highscore.
title: Assault & Battery

description: BJ in 3D Land is the third and final game starring the character BJ. In this title he is lost and needs to complete mazes that are built with a stepped 3D design. BJ needs to move around and collect all diamonds to earn points. He has a small amount of lives and there are multiple screens to explore. Time ticks away at a constant rate and this drains his energy meter. Additional energy is earned by moving on a multicolour energy square. Creatures roam the mazes and when BJ runs into them they drain some energy. When all energy is gone BJ returns to the start. The game keeps track of the score.
title: BJ in 3D Land

description: QL Cavern is a futuristic platform game starring the character BJ set in an underground cave system. It consists of 50 caverns with multiple rooms where 395 diamonds need to be collected. BJ can freely move around, jump and crawl. He needs to avoid hazards and enemies. There are additional elements to the platforming including trampolines, stairs, lifts, teleports, parachutes to drop down and jet-packs. BJ can also use boats to travel on streams and he can swim. Next to the regular rooms exploration is rewarded with hidden screens. Additional lives can be picked up as well. The game keeps track of the overall score.
title: QL Cavern

description: Blocklands Warrior is an arcade game with several scrolling levels that can be explored in any direction. With a limited amount of lives a character needs to be guided through the environment to locate a jewel, which provides the energy to the enemies in the level. These enemies need to be avoided, but can also be shot with a limited amount of ammo available. Additional ammunition, water, coins and a map can be collected. Sometimes keys need to be located as well to open doors to progress to the next level. The game comes with an editor to create custom levels.
title: Blocklands Warrior

description:
Citadel is an action game that is largely an updated version of the developer's earlier title Metropolis. It is a top-down flying game set in a large world made out of 50 fixed-screen environments linked together. The vehicle is moved around based on a thrust mechanic to accelerate along with the ability to turn left or right. The same forward thrust is used as a brake, but then the vehicle needs to be turned around 180 degrees. For difficult situations there is also an air brake that stops the vehicle right away, but this can only be used once per screen.

The overall goal is to reunite the world by collecting and bringing together items. For the West they are teacups and for the East it is bottles of vodka. There are pirates patrolling the streets and the vehicle also needs to avoid guns that fire. There is no way to shoot. There is a limited amount of lives. The screen also shows the current location (East or West), the score, the amount of items, the remaining ships for the current life and the remaining fuel.
title: Citadel

description:
Metropolis is a top-down flying action game set in a large world made out of 50 fixed-screen environments linked together. The vehicle is moved around based on a thrust mechanic to accelerate along with the ability to turn left or right. The same forward thrust is used as a brake, but then the vehicle needs to be turned around 180 degrees. For difficult situations there is also an air brake that stops the vehicle right away, but this can only be used once per screen.

The overall goal is to reunite the world by collecting and bringing together items. For the West they are hamburgers and for the East it is red stars. There are police cars patrolling the streets and the vehicle also needs to avoid guns that fire. There is no way to shoot. There is a limited amount of lives. The screen also shows the current location (East or West), the score, the amount of items, the remaining ships for the current life and the remaining fuel.
title: Metropolis

description:
Spy is an interactive fiction game with graphics. The player takes control of a spy dropped in the East German countryside with a mission to infiltrate a nearby enemy spy centre. The only items provided are a miniature camera and a wrist watch. To get inside, the spy needs to avoid being spotted or shot, and bypass the security measures. Once inside the mission is to take photos of intelligence data and escape.

The top half of the screen shows a visual depiction of the location and the events, while the bottom half shows the text descriptions and lets the player enter commands.
title: Spy

description:
Dark Side of the Moon is a text adventure in which the player guides a space crew in their mission to recapture a moon base and a miracle mine. The game starts when the space craft arrives on the moon and then takes place in four phases. From the craft the trek across the moon's surface needs to be prepared and once the destination is reached problems there need to be solved.

All commands are typed in and there are no graphics. There are 150 locations in total and multiple characters need to be managed, to provide the right tools to the right people according to their expertise. There are puzzles to solve and characters have the ability to carry items with an inventory. Characters will talk with each other and converse with the player.

The text parser is quite strict, only accepting commands in capitals and demanding specific names for items.
title: Dark Side of the Moon

description: Dennis the Dwarf at the Funfear is a texture adventure starring Dennis the Dwarf who previously starred in Horrorday. Issued for review 1986, it was never released until 2016. In this title Dennis the Dwarf explores a closed amusement park after he is thrown out of a local pub with his friend 'Enry the Elf. As soon as they enter the park comes to life and the player guides the characters through humorous escapades and tasks as they battle the park's owner who puts the characters in danger and wants them to perform in his Freak Show.
title: Dennis the Dwarf at the Funfear

description: The Prawn is a text adventure and a spoof of the contemporary The Pawn. In this game the player takes on the role of a prawn who ends up in a strange land after having been scooped up in a trawler net. The game uses many elements present in The Pawn, but the puzzles are not solved in the same way. Some of the locations in the game include a tree stump, an ice tower guarded by a shrimp, a castle with gardens, a mountain with a cave and characters such as a salesperson, a philosopher and a magician.
title: The Prawn

description: Horrorday is a humorous text adventure starring Dennis the Dwarf. He wakes up in a strange land following a booze-filled night with his pal 'Enry the Elf after he is rejected by the fairy Matilda. The fantasy environment where he wakes is filled with horror fantasy creatures such as Dracula look-alikes, werewolves, witches but also a princess called Esmeralda. Dennis needs to explore the world, avoid capture by the witch, and help out Esmeralda to find the love of her life.
title: Horrorday

description:
Dragonhold is an action RPG with a fantasy theme. The player controls a character in a large, four-way scrolling environment shown from a bird's-eye perspective with about 250 screens. The game encourages exploration with locations such as a forest, a cave, a castle, dungeons and so on. The game environment is shown in the large, center part of the screen, an inventory is on the left, and the right side shows attributes for both the character and creatures that are encountered. The typical RPG attributes are charisma, intellect, strength, wisdom, curiosity, weapons, aggression, magic power, PSI power and endurance. Each attribute is represented through a numerical value and these change through certain items and by progressing through the game.

Characters that are encountered include a nagging woman, a dwarf, a thief, a priest, a vampire bat, a troll and so on. It is possible to communicate with many of them. Typical items include weapons and food. The game emphasizes carrying specific items to be able to enter certain areas. For instance, you need to carry a lamp or you cannot go down the dungeons. Item locations and some challenges are randomized for each session. There are both visual and text puzzles. The character is moved about directly using the cursor keys. Other commands are entered though single key presses, from A to X on the keyboard, corresponding with verbs and nouns to interact with the environment. There is a save game feature.
title: Dragonhold

description: Omega is a 3D game played from a first-person perspective. The player assumes the role of a mercenary with codename Omega and the game is set in 2156. Omega's mission is to locate and destroy a government computer hidden in an underground location. The game starts by exploring roads where flying creatures attack frequently. The environment is shown in a rectangular area near the top of the screen. Below, text descriptions are shown on the right and the left side holds a radar where locations of interest pop up. For instance, houses can be entered and searched to collect items. Buildings often lead to mazes with creatures that need to be fought. Attacking is done by moving a cursor over the enemies and then hitting them.
title: Omega

description:
Starplod is a graphic adventure set in space. The player's character wakes up aboard Space Base, a vast space ship that was launched by the Galactic Federation (Gal-Fed). That ship was launched in 2088 with ten thousand colonists following the effects of global warning and pollution on Earth. When the characters wakes, two million years have passed and the ship is in a solar system abandoned by Gal-Fed and under control by pirates. Something has gone wrong during the journey, as the ship lost its backup supply of Moronium fuel and only a few days of fuel is left. On top of that the life support systems generator was damaged.

This problem can only be remedied by locating a precious mineral. The player's character is sent away from the Space Bass in a small exploratory craft, navigating planets and then landing to complete the task. The entire game is icon controlled with about 20 different actions covering movement, but also examination and item management. The icons are shown in a large row near the bottom of the screen. The top left part shows the current location. A top right part shows the available exits from the current location, interesting elements and what the character is holding. Below a large rectangle provides text descriptions of the environments and feedback on actions.
title: Starplod

description:
Wreck Dive is an action game with puzzle-solving elements based around a diver exploring the wreck of the ship The Spindrift sunk in 1954. The diver is in search of treasure as it is rumored wedding gifts valued at around $1 million were on board. The game environment consists of six decks and 140 rooms to explore. Using a top-down view the game environment takes up about one third of the screen largely in the center. The left side of the screen has large vertical area showing the remaining oxygen. Near the bottom the current location is shown and the right part has descriptions of the environment and feedback on actions.

While exploring the diver often needs to return to the air tanks to top up the oxygen again. There are hazards and creatures such as giant clams that can trap the character. The diver is controlled directly using the cursor keys and often needs to be move between the decks. Many items and elements are hidden in the environment and require careful examination. To defeat certain creatures, specific items need to be located, such as a speargun in order to deal with a shark. There are also cutters that need to be located to open up passages, a painting plays an important role and the diver needs to find a way to crack a safe by finding the right combination.
title: Wreck Dive

description: Q*bert is an unofficial adaptation of the classic game Q*bert, here made for the Sinclair QL. In each level the player guides a character through a pyramid-shaped level where you have to jump across a series of blocks to change their colour until every block is changed. Meanwhile there are hazards and enemies that attempt to kill the character.
title: Q*bert
